<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 278, 232, 294]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[836, 278, 907, 294]]<|/det|>
9709/22  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 303, 311, 319]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Pure Mathematics 2  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[730, 303, 907, 320]]<|/det|>
February/March 2022  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 329, 907, 345]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 357, 395, 373]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 384, 390, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 419, 225, 435]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 435, 875, 632]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 664, 215, 679]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 680, 732, 712]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 50.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 74, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 453, 92]]<|/det|>
A curve has equation \(y = 7 + 4\ln (2x + 5)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 104, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the tangent to the curve at the point \((-2, 7)\), giving your answer in the form \(y = mx + c\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 119, 920, 137]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 73, 440, 92]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\sin 2\theta \cot \theta - \cos 2\theta \equiv 1.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 98, 920, 116]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 140, 920, 158]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 183, 920, 201]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 225, 920, 243]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 267, 920, 285]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 310, 920, 327]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 416, 148, 435]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 416, 510, 435]]<|/det|>
Hence find the exact value of \(\sin \frac{1}{6}\pi \cot \frac{1}{12}\pi .\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 416, 920, 435]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 688, 186, 707]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 688, 730, 707]]<|/det|>
Find the smallest positive value of \(\theta\) (in radians) satisfying the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 717, 604, 736]]<|/det|>
\[\sin 2\theta \cot \theta -3\cos 2\theta = 1.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 718, 920, 737]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 77, 94, 96]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 77, 148, 96]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 72, 591, 102]]<|/det|>
Given that \(y = \tan^{2}x\), show that \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = 2\tan x + 2\tan^{3}x.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 77, 920, 96]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 529, 186, 548]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 522, 583, 562]]<|/det|>
Find the exact value of \(\int_{\frac{1}{4}\pi}^{\frac{1}{3}\pi} (\tan x + \tan^2 x + \tan^3 x) \mathrm{d}x.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 530, 920, 549]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 574, 920, 593]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 628, 92]]<|/det|>
Factorise \(\mathrm{p}(x) + 6\) completely and hence solve the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[418, 100, 579, 119]]<|/det|>
\[\mathrm{p}(\mathrm{cos}\mathrm{e}\mathrm{c}2\theta) + 6 = 0\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 125, 306, 144]]<|/det|>
for \(0^{\circ}< \theta < 135^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 125, 920, 144]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
It is required to find the \(x\)-coordinate of \(P\), the point on the curve at which the tangent is parallel to the \(y\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 120, 146, 138]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 120, 584, 139]]<|/det|>
Show that the \(x\)-coordinate of \(P\) satisfies the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[401, 147, 594, 166]]<|/det|>
\[x = \ln 10 - \textstyle \frac{1}{2}\ln (2x - 1).\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 147, 920, 165]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 530, 148, 548]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 530, 920, 579]]<|/det|>
